snippet: A new public database will enable scientists to pinpoint much faster what food is behind a given outbreak and what country it came from, researchers say.
abstract: Free database under construction by the University of California, Davis, aims to catalog the genetic codes of 100,000 types of bacteria found in food, vastly increasing the amount of data that scientists can use to trace the causes of food-borne illness; when fully operational, database is expected to reduce the response time to a given outbreak from weeks to days.
lead_paragraph: A new public database will enable scientists to pinpoint much faster what food is behind a given outbreak and what country it came from, researchers say.
